value: Image detection interface, which can assist you in identifying risks such as politics, pornography, advertising, and terrorism in images; at the same time, it can be combined with your business scenarios to recognize faces, logos, plants, and animals.
Batch detection interface, capable of returning recognition results.

Communication Protocol: HTTP or HTTPS protocol
Request Method: POST method
Character Encoding: utf-8
Parameter Format: All request parameters and response parameters are in JSON format.

Image Types: URL, BASE64.
Image Formats: jpg, jpeg, png, webp, gif, tiff, tif, heif, heic, avif, apng, svg (static image detection is currently supported for svg).
Image Resolution: Currently supports image resolutions ranging from `20px*20px` to `6000px*6000px`, it is recommended that the image pixels are not smaller than `256px*256px`.
Image Size: Synchronous interface is limited to 10M, asynchronous interface is limited to 30M.
Frame Extraction: Long images are not split by default. If you need to enable the splitting feature, please contact Shumei; splitting may increase the number of reviews and billing.
Image Address: It is recommended to download images from a CDN source station, and the source station should not be a single point, otherwise, there may be image download failures, leading to inability to review.

Recommended timeout settings: For synchronous batch request interfaces, it is suggested to set 20 seconds; for asynchronous batch request interfaces, it is suggested to set 5 seconds.

Internal detection logic: The response time of the image detection interface depends on the download time of the image. Please ensure that the storage service where the image to be detected is located is stable and reliable. The connection timeout when ShuMei downloads an image is 2 seconds, and the read timeout is 3 seconds (if failed, it will be retried once). Batch image services are processed in two parallel steps internally, with an average processing time of about 500 milliseconds, which is related to the request type and image size.

When the user's server receives the push result and returns an HTTP status code of 200, it indicates that the push was successful; otherwise, the system will attempt to push again (until the maximum number of retries is reached). The retry logic is to retry after intervals of [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8] seconds, and if it still fails after 8 attempts, no further retries will be made.

value.param_description: View details in the attachment of the account activation email.
Event identifier. It is necessary to agree on the values with Shumei.see email for details.
Application identifier. This field is strictly verified and requires prior agreement with Shumei on the value to be used.see email for details.

Risk types that need to be identified. At least one of type or businessType should be passed, with the following optional values:

POLITY: Political content identification
EROTIC: Erotic and sexy content violation identification
VIOLENT: Violent and prohibited content identification
QRCODE: QR code recognition
ADVERT: Advertisement identification
IMGTEXTRISK: Image text violation identification (if you need to identify violations in text within images, make sure to pass the image text violation identification function)
BOCR: OCR support for small languages and automatic language detection (only available in the Singapore cluster)

If multiple functions need to be identified, connect them with an underscore, such as POLITY_QRCODE_ADVERT for a combination of political, QR code, and advertisement identification.
Business types that need to be identified. Either businessType or type must be passed, with optional values seen in the business label types.
Callback request URL. Passing `callback` indicates asynchronous callback logic, otherwise, synchronous logic is followed. The address must be a standard URL with HTTP or HTTPS protocol.

son.param_description: User account identifier. It is recommended to pass in the user ID, which can be used for risk identification in dimensions such as spamming and advertising.
The array of images to be detected, with a requirement that the array length is within 12.
Client-side request unique identifier
For images to be detected, you can use the base64 encoding of the image or the URL link of the image.

The reference image for comparison detection. When the `businessType` field in the request parameter contains the label `FACECOMPARE`, it exists.
You can use base64 encoded image data or the URL link of the image. Supported formats include:
jpg, jpeg, png, webp, gif, tiff, tif, heif
It is recommended that the image pixel size is not less than 256*256, and the maximum image size is 10MB.
Reference images temporarily do not support long image and animated image formats.
Customer-defined data ID. Can be used for retrieving data in the ShuMei SaaS backend.
Shumei device fingerprint identifier. Generated by the ShuMei SDK, used for user behavior analysis.

User Gender, suggested values:
male: Male
female: Female
ambiguity: Ambiguous

GIF frame extraction frequency. Dedicated to GIF detection, with a default value of 1. One frame is extracted for detection every 'interval' images.

When 'interval' * 'maxFrame' is less than the number of images contained in the picture, the frame extraction interval will automatically be adjusted to the number of images contained in the picture / 'maxFrame', in order to improve the overall detection effect.
The client's public IP address. This parameter is used for user behavior analysis based on the IP dimension.

Language type. When the `type` contains `IMGTEXTRISK`, you can specify the corresponding language type for detection (default is Chinese), with the following options:
- zh: Chinese
- en: English
- ar: Arabic

The maximum number of frames for capturing animated images. When capturing frames from GIFs and other animated images, the maximum is 20 frames, with a default of 3 frames. Billing is based on the actual number of frames captured; for example, if the default is to capture 3 frames, then billing is done according to 3 frames.
The message recipient's tokenId is a string composed of numbers, letters, underscores, and hyphens, with a length of no more than 64 characters.
Auxiliary parameters, used for information related to auxiliary detection.

Should accounts be distinguished across different applications? Possible values are:
0: Do not distinguish
1: Distinguish
The default value is 0.
When the value is set to 1, account systems under different applications are independent of each other, and account-related policy features are individually counted and take effect under different applications.
Live room/game room ID, allowing for the development of different strategies for individual rooms.
Customers transmit pass-through fields. ShuMei will not recognize or process this field internally and will return it to the user along with the results.

Is it the final audit result (if only machine audit is involved, default returns 1)?
0: Not the final result. This indicates that the result is the machine audit result from Shumei Risk Control, and it still needs to go through Shumei's manual review before being returned to your company.
1: Final result. Your company can directly use the returned result for downstream scenarios such as disposal and distribution.

Number of actual processed segments
The model version number corresponding to the incoming type value.

Ad version number. The composition is in the form of `X.Y`, where `X` represents the major version number, usually indicating the overall effect iteration of the model; `Y` represents the minor version number, usually indicating routine daily iterations. For example, `1001001.2` represents a major version number of `1001001` and a minor version number of `2`.

Pornographic version number. The composition is in the form of `X.Y`, where `X` represents the main version number, usually indicating the overall effect iteration of the model; `Y` represents the sub-version number, usually indicating routine daily iterations. For example, `1001001.2` represents a main version number of `1001001` and a sub-version number of `2`.

Non-compliant text version number. The format is `X.Y`, where `X` represents the major version number, usually indicating the overall effect iteration of the model; `Y` represents the minor version number, usually indicating routine daily iterations. For example, `1001001.2` represents a major version number of `1001001` and a minor version number of `2`.

Politically involved version number. The format is `X.Y`, where `X` represents the major version number, usually indicating the overall effect iteration of the model; `Y` represents the minor version number, usually indicating routine daily iterations. For example, `1001001.2` represents a major version number of `1001001` and a minor version number of `2`.

QR Code version number. The composition is in the form of `X.Y`, where `X` represents the major version number, usually indicating the overall effect iteration of the model; `Y` represents the minor version number, usually indicating routine daily iterations. For example, `1001001.2` represents a major version number of `1001001` and a minor version number of `2`.

Terrorism version number. The format is `X.Y`, where `X` represents the main version number, usually indicating the overall effect iteration of the model; `Y` represents the sub-version number, usually indicating routine daily iterations. For example, `1001001.2` represents a main version number of `1001001` and a sub-version number of `2`.

2001: The input data format is incorrect, it is not a valid JSON data.
2002: The input parameter field is illegal (required fields are missing, the type is incorrect, the value is illegal, etc.).
2003: Image download failed.
2004: The image is too large, exceeding 10M.
2005: Illegal image format.
2006: Invalid risk monitoring type.

Disposition and Mapping Results: ShuMei can return the results according to your company's labeling system and identifiers. If a custom labeling system is not configured, this field will not be returned. If you need to enable it, please contact the business manager.
For the batch image asynchronous interface, after the mapping function is enabled, the callback results will change from the previous overall callback to separate callbacks.
When riskLevel is PASS, it is normal.
Level 1 Risk Label. When the number of beauty labels does not map to custom labels, or when the riskLevel under disposal is PASS, return normal.
Secondary risk label. When the number of beauty labels does not map to custom labels, or when the riskLevel under disposal is PASS, it returns empty.
Level 3 Risk Label. Returns empty when the Shumei label is not mapped to a custom label, or when the riskLevel under disposal is PASS.

If your company has its own disposal rules, ShuMei can configure according to your company's disposal logic and return corresponding disposal suggestions; if the rule tags are not mapped, return the default disposal suggestions.
